medical_history.chief_complaint: Anaphylactic-like reaction during cleft lip repair.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The flushing reaction began within approximately 20 to 30 seconds after the first exposure to methylene blue, starting at the site of tattooing and spreading to the face within about half a second. Airway pressures increased significantly from a baseline of 10 to 15 cmH2O to 55 cmH2O shortly after the reaction began.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had a prior topical treatment with gentian violet for a cutaneous fungal infection. No personal or familial allergy history was reported.
medical_history.family_history: There is no family history of clefting. An older sister and grandfather had fine, pale, vertically oriented upper lip scars, but the relevance is unclear.
